intro: Senecio menesesiae, commonly known as the Menesesia Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage is usually gray-green, with narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss. The showy yellow flowers appear in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
